justification: The authors introduce “a child-friendly game – the Four-in-a-row task … as a means to formally quantify the maturation of complex planning and its cognitive component processes across development.”
In the procedure it is stated that “individual differences in fluid reasoning … were assessed using the Matrix Reasoning Item Bank (MaRs-IB).”
The same sentence notes that “daily life impulsive choices … were assessed using the Barratt Impulsiveness Scale-Brief (BIS-Brief).”
The authors report that “orientation towards future events were assessed using the Future Orientation Scale (FOS).”
construct: future orientation / orientation toward future events

justification: Under Model-derived metrics the paper states, “To estimate a participant's playing strength … we used the Elo system … Individual players' Elo ratings are sufficiently precise that they can be used as a metric for playing strength.”
